body.name: 8 Inch Damascus Chef Knife, Professional VG-10 Damascus Super Steel Kitchen Knife, Ultra Sharp Cooking Knife with Ergonomic G10 Handle
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19. Order within 5 hrs 37 mins
features: 【67-layer Damascus Super Steel】Chef knife blade is made of 67 layers of damascus super steel, which has good toughness and high rust resistance. Blade core is composed of VG-10 steel core with high carbon content, after heat treatment, the hardness reaches 62±2HRC, sharp and durable, making it a one of the toughest knives.

【Unique Glass Fiber G10 Handle】Kitchen knife handle adopts frosted glass fiber G10 that excellent insulation, corrosion resistance, wear resistance. Handle adopts wax polishing technology which is much more durable and solider than the wood handle. Perfectly handle providing excellent flexibility and comfort for chef knife.

【Amazing ROSEFINCH Pattern Design】ROSEFINCH has high spirituality and wisdom in traditional Chinese mythology. The blade pattern adopts it's gorgeous feather pattern design, which is clearly layered and very amazing. The blade lens has been sandblasted to achieve super wear resistance of the blade and prevent food from sticking.

【Ultra Sharp Cutting Performance】Cooking knives V-shaped sharp edges hand-honed precisely to 12°on each side to achieve super sharpness (6-8 N), which superior professional-level sharpness that ensures precision cutting thin slices. Which is ideal for cutting vegetables, fruit, bread, fish fillets or meat.

【Great Choice to Kitchen】Utility knife blade is 8 inch long, 2.2mm thickness, knife weight is 222g. It is ideal for your daily cooking and suitable for preparing all types of cuisine—from East to West. HOSHANHO chef knife will be packed in a beautiful gift box, making this knife a perfect gift for yourself and others.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: ■ About Us Established in 1990, HOSHANHO is a new generation of high-end kitchen knife brand. HOSHANHO has a professional R&D team, adhering to tradition, integrating modern high-tech technology, and developing high-quality knives. ROSEFINCH series products are made of high-quality VG-10 damascus super steel, combined with advanced production technology, and strictly control every step, we create knives with a superior quality. ■ HOSHANHO ROSEFINCH Series: HOSHANHO is on a mission to bring more inpsiration and fun into the art of cooking. ROSEFINCH is one of the four spirits of heaven in ancient Chinese mythology. It symbolizes a bright future and hope, can to bring auspiciousness and blessings to people. The ROSEFINCH series draws inspiration from these legendary gods. To create a delicate, sharp, and durable chef's knife that brings more fun and happiness to cooking!
HOSHANHO 67-Layer Damascus Steel Ultra Sharp Chef Knife
8 Inch Chef Knife Multipurpose Designed for Everyday Cooking

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I'll review it again after I've had it awhile. So far, so good. Sharp,nicely made.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Sharp with a good center of balance. Very content so far.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good quality for the knife cost
reviews.reviewText: The knife arrived in a handsome box with magnetic closure - will I keep the knife in the box? No, but it makes the knife feel more special than other knives I have purchased. My main cooking knives are Zwilling J.A. Henckels Twin Select which are very good knives (in my opinion). My cheap knives are also Zwilling J.A. Henckels, but the Motion series. There is no comparison between the two Zwilling sets - the Twin Select has thick blades and is predictable and maintains and edge, while the Motion series is thin blade, flexible and I've cut myself more times than I care to admit.Why all the info about Zwilling knives? I place this Hoshanho knive squarely between the two in quality. The blade is thicker than Motion, but thinner than Twin Select (T.S.). The handle feel and weight is better than Motion and inferior to the T.S. I would have preferred real wood handle, like many Japanese knives - but this doesnt look bad, just not my preference. I do enjoy the 'Damascus' pattern on the blade, but keep in mind this isn't the result of recapturing the lost art of Damascus forging, but artificially recreated. Nevertheless, it still looks good. The blade is sharp and has a quality feel throughout making me believe it will sharpen nicely, when the time comes. I will include this Hoshanho knife in my rotation and hopefully reduce the number of cuts suffered by those stupid Motion knives.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This knife feels great in the hand, and has an excellent look. More importantly, it came with an excellent factory edge that's stayed pretty keen through everything I've thrown at it. Cuts beautifully, and it cleans easy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This knife has been perfect for my kitchen needs. It's beautifully made and cuts like butter

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sharp, feels natural and a pleasure to use
reviews.reviewText: Absolutely lovely. This knife is a well made product. The Damascus steel look is gorgeous. I’m not an expert on this type of forging. This knife says there are 65 folds in the little engraving on it. It’s likely a machine made product now instead of done by hand, but still, it’s striking and beautiful. The folding process does make a very hard strong knife.The packaging is superb and impressively classy. It’s highly giftable.I love the handle of this knife. It’s not wood, but it’s smooth and doesn’t feel slippery. Wood is classic and beautiful, but for knives it’s only one option that works and holds up well. This seems to be really well made. It’s a very comfortable handle, totally ergonomic and natural for my hand. It feels very well balanced heavy enough without being too much weight.The blade cuts wonderfully. It’s super sharp, and the curve of the blade is just right to get the job done with a nice natural rocking motion.I’ve been grabbing this knife a lot lately to do various cutting jobs in my cooking. It hasn’t failed to make me happy.I’m not an expert on knives, but I have been using a well sharpened very large decent quality chef’s knife for years. I’m not professional fussy, but I dislike cheap department store quality for a tool I use this often. I will keep this very sharp knife in good condition, and it seems like every time I put it away I have to just get it out again…it will likely live on my cutting board most of the time. I love this knife. I really do.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It will cut; and this knife will keal!
reviews.reviewText: Pre-review notes: I do not assess value - you can see how much it costs, and you can compare it to other products on and off Amazon. Value is a personal grade - if it's worth it to you, it's worth it. Also, I am no expert on expensive knives - all I know is what I see on the TV show about forging. All that said, this is one beautiful knife! Very sharp right out of the (classy gift) box - seriously sharp. I have a bunch of chef's knives of varied quality and cost - this one out-slices them. I cut up its shipping box - it sliced through the cardboard like it was a tomato. And then I sliced up a tomato - wafer thin slices with no grabbing or crushing. Sweetness! Cutting cardboard is abusive, so I took it to my sharpener; but only the final fine step. Didn't need it. This knife came out of the box sharp and honed - still is. I don't know if the blade is genuine Damascus steel. The pattern seems a bit too regular - and is the same in every picture I've seen in other reviews. But I don't really care - it looks great in my kitchen. Recommended!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great looking Knife
reviews.reviewText: This knife is plenty sharp and well balanced. I have 0 idea what the handle material is made out of... It has a square print on it that could be from the texturing of the handle, or it's a 'printed' wood alternative. Either way, it works.I cannot validate if it's true Damascus or not, sorry :( But it's a great looking knife either way. I did what you shouldn't do, and ran it across a sheet of paper and it cut cleanly through with minimal effort. Using it on chicken and beef was a dream, and easy on tomatoes and veggies.Only time will tell how well the blade will remain sharp. With any nice knifes I recommend using a wooden cutting board, so you don't risk damaging the edge.I'll follow up if anything happens, but for the first week using it multiple times daily, I'm happy with it.
